intro: Chlorocyperus longus f. pallidior, commonly known as the pale chlorocyperus, is a variant of the common chlorocyperus, characterized by its lighter green foliage. It is a perennial grass native to tropical and subtropical regions, often found in wetlands and disturbed soils. The plant features slender, upright stems with narrow, grass-like leaves that are typically less than 10 cm in width. It produces small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in spikelets, which are clustered at the ends of the stems. This variant is valued for its ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in moist environments.
